### CORE: Claude, Cursor, ChatGPT ve TÃ¼m Yapay Zeka AraÃ§larÄ± iÃ§in BirleÅŸik Bellek KatmanÄ±

Content:
Documentation â€¢ Discord

## ğŸ”¥ Research Highlights CORE memory achieves **88.24%** average accuracy in Locomo dataset across all reasoning tasks, significantly outperforming other memory providers. Check out this [blog](https://blog.heysol.ai/we-built-memory-for-individuals-and-achieved-sota-on-locomo-benchmark/) for more info. (1) Single-hop questions require answers based on a single session; (2) Multi-hop questions require synthesizing information from multiple different sessions; (3) Open-domain knowledge questions can be answered by integrating a speakerâ€™s provided information with external knowledge such as commonsense or world facts; (4) Temporal reasoning questions can be answered through temporal reasoning and capturing time-related data cues within the conversation; ## Overview **Problem** Developers waste time re-explaining context to AI tools. Hit token limits in Claude? Start fresh and lose everything. Switch from ChatGPT/Claude to Cursor? Explain your context again. Your conversations, decisions, and insights vanish between sessions. With every new AI tool, the cost of context switching grows. **Solution** - **CORE** (**Contextual Observation & Recall Engine**) CORE is an open-source unified, persistent memory layer for all your AI tools. Your context follows you from Cursor to Claude to ChatGPT to Claude Code. One knowledge graph remembers who said what, when, and why. Connect once, remember everywhere. Stop managing context and start building. ## ğŸš€ Get Started **Build your unified memory graph in 5 minutes:** 1. **Sign Up** at [core.heysol.ai](https://core.heysol.ai) and create your account 2. **Add your first memory** - share context about yourself 3. **Visualize your memory graph** and see how CORE automatically forms connections between facts 5. **Test it out** - ask "What do you know about me?" in conversatio section 6. Connect to your tools: - [Claude](https://docs.heysol.ai/providers/claude) & [Cursor](https://docs.heysol.ai/providers/cursor) - coding with context - [CLaude Code CLI](https://docs.heysol.ai/providers/claude-code) & [Gemini CLI](https://docs.heysol.ai/providers/claude-code) - terminal-based coding with memory - [Add Browser Extension](https://docs.heysol.ai/providers/browser-extension) - bring your memory to any website

## ğŸ§© Key Features

### ğŸ§  **Unified, Portable Memory**: 
Add and recall your memory across **Cursor, Windsurf, Claude Desktop, Claude Code, Gemini CLI, AWS's Kiro, VS Code, and Roo Code** via MCP

![core-claude](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56c98288-ee87-4cd0-8b02-860aca1c7f9a)


### ğŸ•¸ï¸ **Temporal + Reified Knowledge Graph**: 

Remember the story behind every factâ€”track who said what, when, and why with rich relationships and full provenance, not just flat storage

![core-memory-graph](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d1ee659-d519-4624-85d1-e0497cbdd60a)


### ğŸŒ **Browser Extension**: 

Save conversations and content from ChatGPT, Grok, Gemini, Twitter, YouTube, blog posts, and any webpage directly into your CORE memory.

**How to Use Extension**
1. [Download the Extension](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/core-extension/cglndoindnhdbfcbijikibfjoholdjcc) from the Chrome Web Store.
2. Login to [CORE dashboard](https://core.heysol.ai)
   - Navigate to Settings (bottom left)
   - Go to API Key â†’ Generate new key â†’ Name it â€œextension.â€
3. Open the extension, paste your API key, and save.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e629834-1b9d-4fe6-ae58-a9068986036a

Automatically capture relevant context from Linear, Slack, Notion, GitHub and other connected apps into your CORE memory

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Linear, Slack, Notion, GitHub ve diÄŸer baÄŸlÄ± uygulamalardan ilgili baÄŸlamÄ± otomatik olarak CORE belleÄŸinize yakalayÄ±n

Content: ğŸ“– **[View All Integrations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/RedPlanetHQ/core/main/./integrations/README.md)** - Complete list of supported services and their features ![core-slack](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d5fefe38-221e-4076-8a44-8ed673960f03) ### ğŸ”— **MCP Integration Hub**: Connect Linear, Slack, GitHub, Notion once to COREâ€”then use all their tools in Claude, Cursor, or any MCP client with a single URL ![core-linear-claude](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d59d92b-8c56-4745-a7ab-9a3c0341aa32) ## How CORE create memory COREâ€™s ingestion pipeline has four phases designed to capture evolving context: 1. **Normalization**: Links new information to recent context, breaks long documents into coherent chunks while keeping cross-references, and standardizes terms so by the time CORE extracts knowledge, itâ€™s working with clean, contextualized input instead of messy text. 2. **Extraction**: Pulls meaning from normalized text by identifying entities (people, tools, projects, concepts), turning them into statements with context, source, and time, and mapping relationships. For example, â€œWe wrote CORE in Next.jsâ€ becomes: Entities (Core, Next.js), Statement (CORE was developed using Next.js), and Relationship (was developed using). 3. **Resolution**: Detects contradictions, tracks how preferences evolve, and preserves multiple perspectives with provenance instead of overwriting them so memory reflects your full journey, not just the latest snapshot. 4. **Graph Integration**: Connects entities, statements, and episodes into a temporal knowledge graph that links facts to their context and history, turning isolated data into a living web of knowledge agents can actually use. The Result: Instead of a flat database, CORE gives you a memory that grows and changes with you - preserving context, evolution, and ownership so agents can actually use it. ![memory-ingest-eg](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1d0a8007-153a-4842-9586-f6f4de43e647) ## How CORE recalls from memory When you ask CORE a question, it doesnâ€™t just look up text - it digs into your whole knowledge graph to find the most useful answers. 1. **Search**: CORE looks through memory from multiple angles at once - keyword search for exact matches, semantic search for related ideas even if phrased differently, and graph traversal to follow links between connected concepts. 2. **Re-Rank**: The retrieved results are reordered to highlight the most relevant and diverse ones, ensuring you donâ€™t just see obvious matches but also deeper connections. 3. **Filtering**: CORE applies smart filters based on time, reliability, and relationship strength, so only the most meaningful knowledge surfaces.
Translation: ğŸ“– **[TÃ¼m EntegrasyonlarÄ± GÃ¶rÃ¼ntÃ¼le](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/RedPlanetHQ/core/main/./integrations/README.md)** - Desteklenen hizmetlerin ve Ã¶zelliklerinin tam listesi ![core-slack](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d5fefe38-221e-4076-8a44-8ed673960f03) ### ğŸ”— **MCP Entegrasyon Merkezi**: Linear, Slack, GitHub, Notionâ€™u bir kez COREâ€™a baÄŸlayÄ±nâ€”sonra tÃ¼m araÃ§larÄ±nÄ± Claude, Cursor veya herhangi bir MCP istemcisinde tek bir URL ile kullanÄ±n ![core-linear-claude](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d59d92b-8c56-4745-a7ab-9a3c0341aa32) ## CORE nasÄ±l hafÄ±za oluÅŸturur COREâ€™un veri alÄ±m hattÄ±, geliÅŸen baÄŸlamÄ± yakalamak iÃ§in dÃ¶rt aÅŸamadan oluÅŸur: 1. **Normalizasyon**: Yeni bilgileri yakÄ±n zamandaki baÄŸlama baÄŸlar, uzun belgeleri tutarlÄ± bÃ¶lÃ¼mlere ayÄ±rÄ±rken Ã§apraz referanslarÄ± korur ve terimleri standartlaÅŸtÄ±rÄ±r, bÃ¶ylece CORE bilgi Ã§Ä±karÄ±rken daÄŸÄ±nÄ±k metin yerine temiz, baÄŸlamsallaÅŸtÄ±rÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ girdilerle Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r. 2. **Ã‡Ä±karÄ±m**: NormalleÅŸtirilmiÅŸ metinden anlam Ã§Ä±karÄ±r; kiÅŸi, araÃ§, proje, kavram gibi varlÄ±klarÄ± tespit eder, bunlarÄ± baÄŸlam, kaynak ve zaman iÃ§eren ifadelere dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼rÃ¼r ve iliÅŸkileri haritalar. RowTranslations.originContent: Connect Linear, Slack, GitHub, Notion once to COREâ€”then use all their tools in Claude, Cursor, or any MCP client with a single URL

RowTranslations.originContent: COREâ€™s ingestion pipeline has four phases designed to capture evolving context:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: COREâ€™un veri alÄ±m hattÄ±, geliÅŸen baÄŸlamÄ± yakalamak iÃ§in dÃ¶rt aÅŸamadan oluÅŸur:

RowTranslations.originContent: 1. **Normalization**: Links new information to recent context, breaks long documents into coherent chunks while keeping cross-references, and standardizes terms so by the time CORE extracts knowledge, itâ€™s working with clean, contextualized input instead of messy text.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: 1. **Normalizasyon**: Yeni bilgileri yakÄ±n zamandaki baÄŸlama baÄŸlar, uzun belgeleri tutarlÄ± bÃ¶lÃ¼mlere ayÄ±rÄ±rken Ã§apraz referanslarÄ± korur ve terimleri standartlaÅŸtÄ±rÄ±r, bÃ¶ylece CORE bilgi Ã§Ä±karÄ±rken daÄŸÄ±nÄ±k metin yerine temiz, baÄŸlamsallaÅŸtÄ±rÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ girdilerle Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r.

RowTranslations.originContent: 2. **Extraction**: Pulls meaning from normalized text by identifying entities (people, tools, projects, concepts), turning them into statements with context, source, and time, and mapping relationships. For example, â€œWe wrote CORE in Next.jsâ€ becomes: Entities (Core, Next.js), Statement (CORE was developed using Next.js), and Relationship (was developed using).
RowTranslations.translatedContent: 2. **Ã‡Ä±karÄ±m**: NormalleÅŸtirilmiÅŸ metinden anlam Ã§Ä±karÄ±r; kiÅŸi, araÃ§, proje, kavram gibi varlÄ±klarÄ± tespit eder, bunlarÄ± baÄŸlam, kaynak ve zaman iÃ§eren ifadelere dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼rÃ¼r ve iliÅŸkileri haritalar. Ã–rneÄŸin, â€œCOREâ€™u Next.js ile yazdÄ±kâ€ ifadesi: VarlÄ±klar (CORE, Next.js), Ä°fade (CORE Next.js kullanÄ±larak geliÅŸtirildi) ve Ä°liÅŸki (geliÅŸtirildi) ÅŸeklinde ayrÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±lÄ±r.

RowTranslations.originContent: 3. **Resolution**: Detects contradictions, tracks how preferences evolve, and preserves multiple perspectives with provenance instead of overwriting them so memory reflects your full journey, not just the latest snapshot.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: 3. **Ã‡Ã¶zÃ¼mleme**: Ã‡eliÅŸkileri algÄ±lar, tercihlerin nasÄ±l deÄŸiÅŸtiÄŸini izler ve farklÄ± bakÄ±ÅŸ aÃ§Ä±larÄ±nÄ± kaynaklarÄ±yla birlikte korur; bÃ¶ylece hafÄ±za sadece en son hali deÄŸil, tÃ¼m yolculuÄŸunuzu yansÄ±tÄ±r.

RowTranslations.originContent: 4. **Graph Integration**: Connects entities, statements, and episodes into a temporal knowledge graph that links facts to their context and history, turning isolated data into a living web of knowledge agents can actually use.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: 4. **Grafik Entegrasyonu**: VarlÄ±klarÄ±, ifadeleri ve olaylarÄ±, gerÃ§ekleri baÄŸlamÄ±na ve tarihine baÄŸlayan zamansal bilgi grafiÄŸine entegre eder, bÃ¶ylece izole verileri, ajanlarÄ±n gerÃ§ekten kullanabileceÄŸi canlÄ± bir bilgi aÄŸÄ±na dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼rÃ¼r.

Content:
4. **Output**: You get back both facts (clear statements) and episodes (the original context they came from), so recall is always grounded in context, time, and story.

The result: CORE doesnâ€™t just recall facts - it recalls them in the right context, time, and story, so agents can respond the way you would remember.

## ğŸ”’ Security

CORE takes security seriously. We implement industry-standard security practices to protect your data:

- **Data Encryption**: All data in transit (TLS 1.3) and at rest (AES-256)
- **Authentication**: OAuth 2.0 and magic link authentication
- **Access Control**: Workspace-based isolation and role-based permissions
- **Vulnerability Reporting**: Please report security issues to harshith@tegon.ai

For detailed security information, see our [Security Policy](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/RedPlanetHQ/core/main/SECURITY.md).
